FuncDef:
The frr-policy route command configures a filtering policy for OSPF/OSPFv3 IP FRR backup routes to control whether OSPF/OSPFv3 backup routes are added to the routing table.
The undo frr-policy route command disables the device from filtering backup routes for OSPF/OSPFv3 IP FRR. The frr-policy route command configures a filtering policy for OSPF/OSPFv3 IP FRR backup routes to control whether OSPF/OSPFv3 backup routes are added to the routing table. The undo frr-policy route command disables the device from filtering backup routes for OSPF/OSPFv3 IP FRR. By default, OSPF/OSPFv3 IP FRR-enabled backup routes are not filtered.

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies the name of an IP FRR filtering policy.
The name is a string of 1 to 200 case-sensitive characters, with spaces not supported. When double quotation marks are used around the string, spaces are allowed in the string.

ExtraInfo: OSPF/OSPFv3 IP FRR can rapidly switch traffic from a faulty link to a backup link, ensuring uninterrupted traffic transmission. OSPF/OSPFv3 IP FRR is a method to improve OSPF/OSPFv3 network reliability. After an OSPF or OSPFv3 filtering policy is configured using the frr-policy route command, only the backup OSPF or OSPFv3 routes that meet the filtering conditions can be added to the forwarding table. If the primary link fails, OSPF or OSPFv3 can quickly switch traffic to the backup route.
